question_text: A 23-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with fulminant liver failure and hemolytic anemia. She has a history of depression, and her performance at work has declined.Ocular findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is Wilson disease (Option D). The patient's ocular findings show Kayser-Fleischer rings, which are circumferential discolorations that occur in the cornea due to copper deposition in the Descemet membrane. The finding is most easily visible at the inferior and superior poles and usually is seen only on slit-lamp examination in early stages. Kayser-Fleischer rings are associated with Wilson disease but are not pathognomonic for it.
